column4: Does anyone know how to install Ubuntu on a Mac without erasing the contents of the disc it's being installed on?
I don't have anything to backup to though.. :(
yeah, i did that. you have to use the mac tools to partiton first like for installing windows
Yes, but partitioning will erase what's on the disc, right?
I don't have anything to backup onto is the thing.
you don't "need" to backup. the boot camp stuff should work. but if it doesn't well...
Can you thing of anything else to use?
i followed that how to (or maybe it was the one in the wiki) and it worked fine. first step is let OSX create the partition. second step, don't install ubuntu on the first partition :)
you mean making the partition in Boot Camp, right?
yeah, use boot camp to set it up. it thinks you are going to install windows. ignore that. just create the parition and then install ubuntu to THAT partition
Hm. This might be tricky, I don't have Leopard and I never installed Boot Camp when it was public. I'll figure something out.
